name: Kepler-395
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-395 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-395 is a star with 0.45999999999999985 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.56 times its radius. It is located 1390.53 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-395 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-395 b

Kepler-395 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.05 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-395.

The mass of Kepler-395 b is 1.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-395 b is 1.03 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-395 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-395 c

Kepler-395 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 34.99 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-395.

The mass of Kepler-395 c is 1.88 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-395 c is 1.32 that of Earth. At 1.88 Earth masses, Kepler-395 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.177 astronomical units, and a mass of 1.88 Earth masses, Kepler-395 c could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-395, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
